context: A security incident was reported where emails containing a malicious URL `https://ym018491661.wittytree-b6f239d6.northeurope.azurecontainerapps.io/` were delivered to and later removed from the mailbox of `bjenkins@niseko.alpineskihouse.co`. The email was sent from `santiago@vnevado.alpineskihouse.co` with the sender IP `119.36.50.193`. This incident involves the user account `Lucas Grey` with email `Lucas Grey@niseko.alpineskihouse.co`.
question: During the investigation of the incident, a suspicious sequence of exploration activities was detected. Can you provide the Security Identifier (Sid) of the account involved in these suspicious activities?
solution_steps: The email account with SID `S-1-5-21-561436748-3867387497-1732241745-3701` received an email with a malicious URL that was delivered and later removed.
A process `powershell.exe` scanned or dumped memory from the Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (lsass.exe), potentially allowing the attacker to extract authentication hashes or passwords.

The account with SID `S-2-5-21-571436798-3864380397-1837441745-3206` executed a suspicious sequence of windows commands to identify assets of value and coordinate lateral movement after compromising a machine.
